page.title: 01General Description.
page.content: This is a predominantly rural area bounded to the North by the A2,a busy dual carriageway linking Dover to London and acting as a by-pass for all the North Kent towns.The A2 also acts as a boundary for the building developement spreading South from Gravesend.Much of the area is devoted to farming ,mainly cereal crops are grown ,most of the more traditional orchards and hop fields have now been replaced.Some farms are growing strawberries as a new venture. Tucked in to the South-West corner of the block is the picturesque village of Cobham.The village has a number of interesting buildings. Although this is still very much a rural area,the agricultural community has given way to a more commuter based society.
